channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: FBI searches WaPo reporter's home. And, Trump restores $2B to public health funds
item.description: The FBI searches the home of a Washington Post reporter as part of a leak investigation. And, the Trump administration restores $2B for mental health and addiction programs.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI searches the home of a Washington Post reporter as part of a leak investigation. And, the Trump administration restores $2B for mental health and addiction programs.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: European troops arrive in Greenland to boost the Arctic island's security
item.description: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.
item.content:encoded:
Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Uganda goes to the polls amid heavy security and internet blackout
item.description: Ugandans are voting in a tense presidential election as 81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni seeks to extend his four-decade rule amid an internet shutdown and heavy military deployment.
item.content:encoded:
Ugandans are voting in a tense presidential election as 81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni seeks to extend his four-decade rule amid an internet shutdown and heavy military deployment.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: What Teddy Roosevelt has to do with Trump's moves in Venezuela and Greenland
item.description: Presidents James Monroe and Theodore Roosevelt helped shape a policy that rationalizes U.S. intervention in Latin America and elsewhere. But Trump has brought that idea to a whole new level.
item.content:encoded:
Presidents James Monroe and Theodore Roosevelt helped shape a policy that rationalizes U.S. intervention in Latin America and elsewhere. But Trump has brought that idea to a whole new level.

(Image credit: William Allen Rogers)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: 4 ways to beat the anxiety of insomnia — and get back to sleep
item.description: People struggling with insomnia tend to hyperfocus on the fact that they can't sleep, which can prevent them from getting any shut-eye. Experts share effective practices to overcome sleep stress.
item.content:encoded: People struggling with insomnia tend to hyperfocus on the fact that they can't sleep, which can prevent them from getting any shut-eye. Experts share effective practices to overcome sleep stress.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: More students are going to college. Affordability and workforce training are factors
item.description: Overall enrollment is up slightly at colleges and universities, driven by gains at community colleges and public four-year programs.
item.content:encoded: Overall enrollment is up slightly at colleges and universities, driven by gains at community colleges and public four-year programs.
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: After a medical evacuation from space, NASA's Crew-11 returns to Earth a month early
item.description: Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego, successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.
item.content:encoded:
Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego, successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: Julio Iglesias accused of sexual assault as Spanish prosecutors study the allegations
item.description: Spanish prosecutors are studying allegations that Grammy-winning singer Julio Iglesias sexually assaulted two former employees at his residences in the Dominican Republic and the Bahamas.
item.content:encoded:
Spanish prosecutors are studying allegations that Grammy-winning singer Julio Iglesias sexually assaulted two former employees at his residences in the Dominican Republic and the Bahamas.

(Image credit: Carlos Giusti)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: DHS: ICE officers in Minneapolis shoot Venezuelan man in the leg
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security says the shooting happened after the agent came under attack. Protestors have taken to the streets in Minneapolis, clashing with federal agents, after Renee Macklin Good's killing last week.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Homeland Security says the shooting happened after the agent came under attack. Protestors have taken to the streets in Minneapolis, clashing with federal agents, after Renee Macklin Good's killing last week.

(Image credit: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: FBI searches a Washington Post reporter's home as part of investigation
item.description: Hannah Natanson had a phone, two laptops and a Garmin watch seized. The Justice Department says this is part of an investigation into a Pentagon contractor accused of taking home classified information.
item.content:encoded:
Hannah Natanson had a phone, two laptops and a Garmin watch seized. The Justice Department says this is part of an investigation into a Pentagon contractor accused of taking home classified information.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
